meanings.definition: Showing deep unhappiness of thought; contemplative and moody.
meanings.sent1: The broodier sky matched his somber mood.
meanings.sent2: She became broodier as the day went on, lost in her thoughts.
meanings.sent3: The broodier cat sat by the window, looking out sadly at the rain.
meanings.sent4: His broodier demeanor cast a shadow over the room.
meanings.sent5: The broodier music played softly in the background, setting a melancholic tone.

meanings.definition: Tending to brood over past events or worries.
meanings.sent1: Her broodier nature made it hard for her to let go of the past.
meanings.sent2: He was broodier than usual after receiving the bad news.
meanings.sent3: The broodier old man spent hours reminiscing about his youth.
meanings.sent4: The broodier clouds seemed to mirror his constant worrying.
meanings.sent5: She had a broodier tendency to dwell on what could have been.

meanings.definition: Having a dark or gloomy appearance.
meanings.sent1: The broodier room was lit only by a dim lamp.
meanings.sent2: The forest had a broodier atmosphere as night fell.
meanings.sent3: The broodier painting seemed to absorb all the light in the room.
meanings.sent4: The broodier landscape was shrouded in mist, adding to its eerie charm.
meanings.sent5: The broodier clouds loomed overhead, threatening rain.
